content: After reading this (x2, actually, on the theory that I didn’t have enough caffeine to make sense of it), trundled off to look at your feed. Liked that; this, not so much. Now, I will freely, if not happily, admit that I may have not gotten the point, so I shan’t be offended if (when?) you tell me I’m an idiot. That said, idiotic moi experiences this piece as a kind of misfiring satire, in part because it might make a non-depressed person think people with MDD can — as a general matter — avoid appearing depressed (as in lethargic, etc.) People with, say, dysthymia, might appear like this from time to time, and I will concede that a person with MDD might — for a short period of time — manage to stave off appearing depressed. But, I don’t believe it’s possible for anyone with some flavor of MDD to act otherwise for any sustained amount of time, e.g., the workday, so I think someone who didn’t get the “satire” might think you were serious, which in turn might create more confusion, about the last thing the depressed need. But I could be (am? is? are?) wrong….
